column1: Astronomers Introduction Introduction video What is Astronomy?
column2: Astronomers Introduction Introduction video What is Astronomy ?
column3: Astronomes Introduction Vidéo d'introduction Qu'est-ce que l'astronomie?

column1: Often considered the oldest science, it was born of our amazement at the sky and our need to question Astronomy is the science of space beyond Earth’s atmosphere.
column2: Often considered the oldest science , it was born of our amazement at the sky and our need to question Astronomy is the science of space beyond Earth 's atmosphere .
column3: Souvent considérée comme la plus ancienne des sciences, elle découle de notre étonnement et de nos questionnements envers le ciel L'astronomie est la science qui étudie l'Univers au-delà de l'atmosphère terrestre.

column1: The name is derived from the Greek root astron for star, and nomos for arrangement or law.
column2: The name is derived from the Greek root astron for star , and nomos for arrangement or law .
column3: Son nom vient du grec astron, qui veut dire étoile et nomos, qui veut dire loi.

column1: Astronomy is concerned with celestial objects and phenomena – like stars, planets, comets and galaxies – as well as the large-scale properties of the Universe, also known as "The Big Picture".
column2: Astronomy is concerned with celestial objects and phenomena -- like stars , planets , comets and galaxies -- as well as the large-scale properties of the Universe , also known as `` The Big Picture '' .
column3: Elle s'intéresse à des objets et des phénomènes tels que les étoiles, les planètes, les comètes, les galaxies et les propriétés de l'Univers à grande échelle.

column1: More specifically, astronomy is the study of the origin and evolution of the Universe, the physics and chemistry of celestial objects, and the calculation of their positions and motions.
column2: More specifically , astronomy is the study of the origin and evolution of the Universe , the physics and chemistry of celestial objects , and the calculation of their positions and motions .
column3: Plus spécifiquement, elle étudie la formation et l'évolution de l'Univers, détermine les propriétés physiques et chimiques des objets célestes qu'il contient et mesure leurs déplacements.

column1: For most people, astronomy represents a world that is both mysterious and grandiose – a story about glimmering celestial objects and the immensity of the cosmos.
column2: For most people , astronomy represents a world that is both mysterious and grandiose -- a story about glimmering celestial objects and the immensity of the cosmos .
column3: Pour la majorité des gens, l'astronomie évoque un monde à la fois mystérieux et grandiose, celui des étoiles et de l'immensité cosmique.

column1: It prompts us to ask the deepest existential questions:
column2: It prompts us to ask the deepest existential questions :
column3: L'astronomie évoque donc aussi les grandes questions « existentielles » :

column1: Who are we?
column2: Who are we ?
column3: Où sommes-nous?

column1: Where did we come from?
column2: Where did we come from ?
column3: D'où venons-nous?

column1: Are we alone?
column2: Are we alone ?
column3: Sommes-nous seuls?

column1: The lure of these universal enigmas was the spark that ignited the passion of many of today’s famous astronomers.
column2: The lure of these universal enigmas was the spark that ignited the passion of many of today 's famous astronomers .
column3: L'attrait exercé par ces énigmes universelles a représenté l'étincelle initiale du parcours de nombreux grands astronomes.

column1: Astronomy also plays a much more practical role that is not nearly as important today as it was in the past.
column2: Astronomy also plays a much more practical role that is not nearly as important today as it was in the past .
column3: L'astronomie possède également une dimension beaucoup plus pratique et « terre à terre », laquelle est moins apparente aujourd'hui.

column1: Since the time of our earliest ancestors, humans have used the motions of celestial objects to position themselves in space and time.
column2: Since the time of our earliest ancestors , humans have used the motions of celestial objects to position themselves in space and time .
column3: Depuis toujours, nous observons les mouvements du ciel pour nous repérer dans l'espace et le temps.

column1: Prehistoric humans studied the relationship between the seasons and the length of days to plan their hunting and gathering activities.
column2: Prehistoric humans studied the relationship between the seasons and the length of days to plan their hunting and gathering activities .
column3: Ainsi, l'homme préhistorique connaît bien la relation existant entre la variation de la durée du jour et le cycle des saisons; il s'en sert pour planifier ses déplacements de chasse et de cueillette.

column1: It was also by observing the positions of the stars that the first farmers decided when to plant and when to harvest, and early navigators could sail the oceans blue.
column2: It was also by observing the positions of the stars that the first farmers decided when to plant and when to harvest , and early navigators could sail the oceans blue .
column3: C'est aussi en observant la position des étoiles que les premiers agriculteurs décident du moment des grandes étapes de leur travail et que les navigateurs se repèrent sur les mers.

column1: In the Age of Antiquity, astrometry – the measurement of the positions of stars and planets – was the main occupation of astronomers.
column2: In the Age of Antiquity , astrometry -- the measurement of the positions of stars and planets -- was the main occupation of astronomers .
column3: Durant l'Antiquité, l'astrométrie, qui est la mesure de la position des étoiles et des planètes, est la principale occupation des astronomes.

column1: There was some degree of interest for astronomy from the general public as well, since they believed that the positions of celestial objects influenced events that took place on Earth.
column2: There was some degree of interest for astronomy from the general public as well , since they believed that the positions of celestial objects influenced events that took place on Earth .
column3: Pour le public, le travail n'est pas sans intérêt : on croit en effet que la position des objets célestes a un impact sur les évènements qui ont cours sur la Terre.

column1: During the Renaissance, advances in mathematics coupled with the invention of new observational instruments (like the refracting telescope) gave rise to modern astronomy.
column2: During the Renaissance , advances in mathematics coupled with the invention of new observational instruments -LRB- like the refracting telescope -RRB- gave rise to modern astronomy .
column3: Lors de la Renaissance, les progrès en mathématiques réalisés depuis l'Antiquité et l'invention de nouveaux instruments d'observation (comme la lunette astronomique) conduisent à la naissance de l'astronomie moderne.

column1: From the 19th century onwards, the discovery of the electromagnetic spectrum and the world of the atom spurred on the development of astrophysics, a new discipline in astronomy that is now considered to be the most important.
column2: From the 19th century onwards , the discovery of the electromagnetic spectrum and the world of the atom spurred on the development of astrophysics , a new discipline in astronomy that is now considered to be the most important .
column3: À partir de la fin du XIXe siècle, la découverte du spectre électromagnétique et du monde de l'atome va aussi mener à l'apparition d'une nouvelle branche de l'astronomie, la plus importante de nos jours : l'astrophysique.

column1: Today, astronomy covers several disciplines:
column2: Today , astronomy covers several disciplines :
column3: Aujourd'hui, l'astronomie comprend plusieurs disciplines dont :

column1: ◦ Astrometry, which is the precise measurement of the position of stars and planets, and which is greatly facilitated by the use of modern CCD cameras and computers
column2: ◦ Astrometry , which is the precise measurement of the position of stars and planets , and which is greatly facilitated by the use of modern CCD cameras and computers
column3: ◦ L'astrométrie, qui se charge de mesurer la position des étoiles et des planètes (et dont la pratique est aujourd'hui facilitée par l'utilisation des caméras CCD et des ordinateurs)

column1: ◦ Stellar astronomy, which is the study of the origins and evolution of stars
column2: ◦ Stellar astronomy , which is the study of the origins and evolution of stars
column3: ◦ L'astronomie stellaire, qui étudie l'origine, la formation et l'évolution des étoiles

column1: ◦ Galactic astronomy, which studies the structure and components of galaxies
column2: ◦ Galactic astronomy , which studies the structure and components of galaxies
column3: ◦ L'astronomie galactique, qui étudie la structure et les composants des galaxies

column1: ◦ Astrophysics, which studies the Universe and the physics of its constituents (luminosity, temperature, chemical composition)
column2: ◦ Astrophysics , which studies the Universe and the physics of its constituents -LRB- luminosity , temperature , chemical composition -RRB-
column3: ◦ L'astrophysique, qui étudie la physique de l'Univers et les propriétés physiques de ses constituants (luminosité, température, composition chimique)

column1: ◦ Cosmology, which studies the origin and evolution of the Universe as a whole Related to these fields of research are two disciplines that lie more within the domain of geologists and biologists: planetary science, which is the study of asteroids, comets and planets, and astrobiology, which studies the possibility of life in the Universe.
column2: ◦ Cosmology , which studies the origin and evolution of the Universe as a whole Related to these fields of research are two disciplines that lie more within the domain of geologists and biologists : planetary science , which is the study of asteroids , comets and planets , and astrobiology , which studies the possibility of life in the Universe .
column3: ◦ La cosmologie, qui étudie l'origine et l'évolution de l'Univers dans son ensemble À ces domaines de recherche se rattachent deux disciplines qui sont surtout l'apanage des géologues et des biologistes : les sciences des planètes, qui se chargent de l'étude des astéroïdes, des comètes et des planètes, et l'astrobiologie, qui se charge de l'étude des possibilités de vie dans l'Univers.

column1: Nowadays, professional astronomers have a strong background in astrophysics and their observations are almost always examined in an astrophysical context.
column2: Nowadays , professional astronomers have a strong background in astrophysics and their observations are almost always examined in an astrophysical context .
column3: Actuellement, les astronomes professionnels ont tous une formation poussée en astrophysique et leurs observations sont presque toujours étudiées dans un contexte astrophysique.

column1: The most serious amateurs actively participate in the study of variable stars, the discovery of new asteroids or comets, and other exciting astronomical work.
column2: The most serious amateurs actively participate in the study of variable stars , the discovery of new asteroids or comets , and other exciting astronomical work .
column3: Les astronomes amateurs jouent également un rôle important en recherche; les plus sérieux participant couramment au suivi d'étoiles variables, à la découverte de nouveaux astéroïdes et de nouvelles comètes, etc.

column1: The impetus for Canada’s first government observatory came from the Geological Survey of Canada, which had a pressing need for a service that could supply precise temporal and spatial coordinates for its mapping and topographic surveys.
column2: The impetus for Canada 's first government observatory came from the Geological Survey of Canada , which had a pressing need for a service that could supply precise temporal and spatial coordinates for its mapping and topographic surveys .
column3: Sa création est due à la Commission Géologique du Canada qui avait alors un besoin pressant de disposer d'un service capable de fournir des coordonnées temporelles et spatiales précises pour ses relevés cartographiques et topographiques.

column1: In those days, only observatories were capable of providing such a service.
column2: In those days , only observatories were capable of providing such a service .
column3: À l'époque, seul un observatoire astronomique peut fournir ce genre de service.

column1: William Frederick King, Chief Astronomer for the Department of the Interior, played a key role in setting up the new observatory.
column2: William Frederick King , Chief Astronomer for the Department of the Interior , played a key role in setting up the new observatory .
column3: Le chef de la Division d'Astronomie du Ministère de l'Intérieur, l'astronome William Frederick King, joue un rôle clé dans la mise sur pied du nouvel observatoire.

column1: He became its first Director and equipped it with a 35-centimetre telescope, the largest ever installed in Canada.
column2: He became its first Director and equipped it with a 35-centimetre telescope , the largest ever installed in Canada .
column3: Il en devient le premier directeur et l'équipe d'une lunette astronomique de 35 centimètres, la plus grande jamais installée au Canada.

column1: The first mandate of the observatory was to determine and distribute the exact time to the rest of the country.
column2: The first mandate of the observatory was to determine and distribute the exact time to the rest of the country .
column3: La première partie du mandat de l'observatoire est de fournir des coordonnées temporelles au pays, c'est-à-dire l'heure exacte.

column1: King confided this task to Robert Meldrum Stewart, the astronomer who went on to become Director from 1923 to 1946.
column2: King confided this task to Robert Meldrum Stewart , the astronomer who went on to become Director from 1923 to 1946 .
column3: King confie cette tâche à l'astronome Robert Meldrum Stewart, qui deviendra lui-même directeur de l'observatoire de 1923 à 1946.

column1: More specifically, it was necessary to know the exact moment when certain stars passed their highest point in the sky (the meridian); these were known as "transit times".
column2: More specifically , it was necessary to know the exact moment when certain stars passed their highest point in the sky -LRB- the meridian -RRB- ; these were known as `` transit times '' .
column3: Pour déterminer l'heure exacte, il faut observer sur une base régulière le transit d'étoiles de référence, c'est-à-dire le moment précis où certaines étoiles passent par leur point le plus élevé dans le ciel, appelé aussi le méridien.

column1: Due to the conscientious observation of transit times for many stars, and to the acquisition of a high precision clock in 1929, Stewart gradually established a network of clocks throughout Ottawa’s federal government buildings.
column2: Due to the conscientious observation of transit times for many stars , and to the acquisition of a high precision clock in 1929 , Stewart gradually established a network of clocks throughout Ottawa 's federal government buildings .
column3: Grâce aux observations du transit de plusieurs étoiles, d'abord, puis à l'acquisition en 1929 d'une horloge de haute précision, Stewart met graduellement en place un réseau d'horloges dans les édifices du gouvernement canadien, à Ottawa.

column1: A signal from the observatory’s clock was electronically transmitted to the buildings; in this way, about 700 clocks in Ottawa were able to display precise time by 1930.
column2: A signal from the observatory 's clock was electronically transmitted to the buildings ; in this way , about 700 clocks in Ottawa were able to display precise time by 1930 .
column3: Le signal de l'horloge de l'observatoire est transmis électriquement aux édifices de la ville et, en 1930, environ 700 horloges d'Ottawa obtiennent ainsi l'heure exacte.

column1: After 1941, this time service was extended to the entire country and the Dominion Observatory became the official supplier of time for Canada.
column2: After 1941 , this time service was extended to the entire country and the Dominion Observatory became the official supplier of time for Canada .
column3: À partir de 1941, le service de l'heure est étendu à tout le pays et l'Observatoire Fédéral devient le fournisseur de l'heure officielle au Canada.

column1: In order to fulfill its second mandate – to provide spatial coordinates for the country – the Dominion Observatory set out to determine the precise position of 3,162 stars in the sky.
column2: In order to fulfill its second mandate -- to provide spatial coordinates for the country -- the Dominion Observatory set out to determine the precise position of 3,162 stars in the sky .
column3: Afin de remplir la seconde partie de son mandat, qui est de fournir des coordonnées spatiales au pays, l'Observatoire Fédéral travaille à déterminer les positions précises de 3162 étoiles dans le ciel.

column1: This was accomplished by recording 28,000 astronomical observations from 1911 to 1923.
column2: This was accomplished by recording 28,000 astronomical observations from 1911 to 1923 .
column3: Le tout nécessite quelque 28 000 observations astronomiques qui s'échelonnent de 1911 à 1923.

column1: A new project was launched in 1923, and the positions of another 1,368 stars were measured until 1950.
column2: A new project was launched in 1923 , and the positions of another 1,368 stars were measured until 1950 .
column3: De 1923 à 1950, un nouveau programme d'observation est lancé et les positions de 1368 autres étoiles sont mesurées.

column1: These data – combined with the knowledge of exact time – allowed longitude, latitude and elevation to be calculated with precision for many points across Canada.
column2: These data -- combined with the knowledge of exact time -- allowed longitude , latitude and elevation to be calculated with precision for many points across Canada .
column3: Toutes ces données, combinées à la connaissance de l'heure exacte au pays, permettront d'établir avec précision la longitude, la latitude et l'altitude de plusieurs points au Canada.

column1: As part of its responsibility to the Geological Survey of Canada, the Dominion Observatory was also entrusted with a third mandate: to collect seismic, gravimetric and magnetic geophysical data.
column2: As part of its responsibility to the Geological Survey of Canada , the Dominion Observatory was also entrusted with a third mandate : to collect seismic , gravimetric and magnetic geophysical data .
column3: Comme l'Observatoire Fédéral dépend de la Commission Géologique du Canada, un troisième mandat lui est également confié lors de sa création, soit la collecte de données géophysiques de nature sismique, gravimétrique et magnétique.

column1: Among the noteworthy events that marked the history of the Dominion Observatory were the apparent discovery of "Planet X" in 1928, the determination of the solar rotation as a function of latitude in the 1930’s, and the discovery of numerous meteor impact sites in Canada.
column2: Among the noteworthy events that marked the history of the Dominion Observatory were the apparent discovery of `` Planet X '' in 1928 , the determination of the solar rotation as a function of latitude in the 1930 's , and the discovery of numerous meteor impact sites in Canada .
column3: Parmi les évènements qui ont marqué l'histoire de l'Observatoire Fédéral, notons la découverte apparente de la « Planète X » en 1928, la détermination de la rotation du Soleil en fonction de la latitude dans les années 1930 et la découverte de nombreux impacts météoritiques au Canada.

column1: Scientific institutions in Canada were reorganized in 1970 and the responsibilities of the Dominion Observatory were transferred to the National Research Council of Canada (NRC).
column2: Scientific institutions in Canada were reorganized in 1970 and the responsibilities of the Dominion Observatory were transferred to the National Research Council of Canada -LRB- NRC -RRB- .
column3: En 1970, les institutions scientifiques du Canada sont réorganisées et la responsabilité de l'Observatoire Fédéral est confiée au Conseil National de Recherches du Canada.

column2: The observatory ceased its activities and the building became the headquarters for the NRC .

column1: Its creation was motivated by the growing need of Canadian astronomers to have access to a large world-class telescope.
column2: Its creation was motivated by the growing need of Canadian astronomers to have access to a large world-class telescope .

column1: The observatory immediately achieved international status by housing a 1.83-metre telescope that was the largest operating telescope in the world, although it only held this title for a few months.
column2: The observatory immediately achieved international status by housing a 1.83-metre telescope that was the largest operating telescope in the world , although it only held this title for a few months .
column3: Doté dès son inauguration d'un télescope de 1,83 mètre, l'Observatoire Fédéral d'Astrophysique aura en effet, pendant quelques mois, le plus grand télescope au monde.

column1: The installation of the telescope was largely the work of celebrated Canadian astronomer John Stanley Plaskett, and the instrument was baptized the "Plaskett Telescope" in his honour.
column2: The installation of the telescope was largely the work of celebrated Canadian astronomer John Stanley Plaskett , and the instrument was baptized the `` Plaskett Telescope '' in his honour .
column3: La conception du télescope est en grande partie l'œuvre du célèbre astronome canadien John Stanley Plaskett ; le télescope de l'observatoire est d'ailleurs baptisé « Télescope de Plaskett » en son honneur.

column1: It measured 15 metres long and its mobile parts weighed 42 tonnes.
column2: It measured 15 metres long and its mobile parts weighed 42 tonnes .

column2: Plaskett became the first Director of the Dominion Astrophysical Observatory and helped it establish an international research reputation very early on .

column1: In 1922, for example, he discovered a binary star and the larger of the two still holds the record as the most massive known binary star.
column2: In 1922 , for example , he discovered a binary star and the larger of the two still holds the record as the most massive known binary star .
column3: En 1922, il découvre en effet une étoile binaire dont l'étoile principale est la plus massive connue jusqu'alors.

column2: This celestial body bears the name of `` Plaskett 's Star '' in his honour .

column1: During subsequent years, Plaskett established the radial velocities of several stars (that is, the speed at which the stars are moving away or toward the observer) and demonstrated that our galaxy, the Milky Way, is rotating.
column2: During subsequent years , Plaskett established the radial velocities of several stars -LRB- that is , the speed at which the stars are moving away or toward the observer -RRB- and demonstrated that our galaxy , the Milky Way , is rotating .

column1: He was also the first to measure the size, mass and rotational speed of the Milky Way.

column1: He also established that the Sun is located at 2/3 the distance from the centre of our galaxy to its edge, and that our solar system takes approximately 22 million years to complete one galaxial rotation.
column2: He also established that the Sun is located at 2/3 the distance from the centre of our galaxy to its edge , and that our solar system takes approximately 22 million years to complete one galaxial rotation .

column2: Andrew McKellar , one of the observatory 's astronomers , became the first researcher to detect the presence of matter in interstellar space when he identified the spectral bands for the organic compounds cyanogen -LRB- `` CN '' -RRB- and methyne -LRB- `` CH '' -RRB- .

column1: His family immigrated to Canada in 1862 and settled down at Port Hope, Ontario.
column2: His family immigrated to Canada in 1862 and settled down at Port Hope , Ontario .

column1: In 1875, he obtained his bachelor’s degree with high distinctions from the University of Toronto, and he also earned the university’s gold medal in mathematics.
column2: In 1875 , he obtained his bachelor 's degree with high distinctions from the University of Toronto , and he also earned the university 's gold medal in mathematics .
column3: En 1875, il obtient son baccalauréat avec haute distinction de l'Université de Toronto, où il décroche la médaille d'or de l'université en mathématiques.

column1: He spent his free time at the university performing complex mathematical calculations for personal amusement.
column2: He spent his free time at the university performing complex mathematical calculations for personal amusement .
column3: Toute sa vie durant, il occupera d'ailleurs ses temps libres à effectuer des calculs mathématiques complexes pour le plaisir.

column1: Later during his career, the University of Toronto awarded him an honorary doctoral degree for his work in astronomy in 1904.
column2: Later during his career , the University of Toronto awarded him an honorary doctoral degree for his work in astronomy in 1904 .
column3: En 1904, l'Université de Toronto lui décerne un doctorat honorifique pour ses travaux en astronomie.

column1: King published many scientific articles on astronomy.
column2: King published many scientific articles on astronomy .
column3: King publie plusieurs articles scientifiques en astronomie.

column1: Without doubt, the most significant was his classic article The Geometry of Orbits in which he described a new method for calculating the orbits of binary stars.
column2: Without doubt , the most significant was his classic article The Geometry of Orbits in which he described a new method for calculating the orbits of binary stars .
column3: Le plus important est sans doute « La géométrie des orbites », un article devenu un classique dans lequel il décrit une nouvelle méthode pour calculer les orbites d'étoiles binaires.

column1: The relative obscurity of his scientific career is more than compensated by his famous achievements as astronomer and administrator for the Canadian Government.
column2: The relative obscurity of his scientific career is more than compensated by his famous achievements as astronomer and administrator for the Canadian Government .
column3: Si sa carrière scientifique passe presque inaperçue, il en est tout autrement du rôle majeur qu'il joue en tant qu'astronome et administrateur au sein du gouvernement canadien.

column1: It was under his guidance that astronomy really took off in Canada, developing first at the national scale and then rising to international stature.
column2: It was under his guidance that astronomy really took off in Canada , developing first at the national scale and then rising to international stature .
column3: C'est en effet sous sa gouverne que l'astronomie canadienne prend son véritable envol et se développe au niveau national et international.

column1: King entered the Canadian Government as a land surveyor and topographer in 1872 at the age of 18.
column2: King entered the Canadian Government as a land surveyor and topographer in 1872 at the age of 18 .
column3: King entre au service du gouvernement canadien en tant qu'arpenteur-géomètre et topographe en 1872, à l'âge de 18 ans.

column1: He worked on federal lands in western Canada where his knowledge of astronomy was an asset during mapping as it allowed him to determine the longitudes and latitudes of many locations.
column2: He worked on federal lands in western Canada where his knowledge of astronomy was an asset during mapping as it allowed him to determine the longitudes and latitudes of many locations .
column3: Il travaille sur les terres fédérales de l'ouest du pays où ses connaissances en astronomie sont misent à profit en cartographie, dans la détermination des longitudes et latitudes de nombreux lieux.

column1: He rose step by step through the government echelons until his nomination as Chief Inspector of Surveys for the Department of the Interior in 1886.
column2: He rose step by step through the government echelons until his nomination as Chief Inspector of Surveys for the Department of the Interior in 1886 .
column3: Il gravit petit à petit les échelons au sein du gouvernement, jusqu'à sa nomination en tant qu'inspecteur en chef de l'arpentage au Ministère de l'Intérieur en 1886.

column1: In 1887, King began to pressure the government into creating a federal astronomical observatory.
column2: In 1887 , King began to pressure the government into creating a federal astronomical observatory .
column3: En 1887, King commence à faire pression au sein du gouvernement pour la création d'un observatoire astronomique fédéral.

column1: In 1890, he founded the Astronomy Division of the Department of the Interior with the help of Edward Gaston Daniel Deville and Otto Julius Klotz.
column2: In 1890 , he founded the Astronomy Division of the Department of the Interior with the help of Edward Gaston Daniel Deville and Otto Julius Klotz .
column3: En 1890, il fonde, avec l'aide de Edward Gaston Daniel Deville et Otto Julius Klotz, la Division d'Astronomie du Ministère de l'Intérieur et en devient le chef la même année.

column1: He became its first director that same year and built a small wooden observatory on Cliff Street.
column2: He became its first director that same year and built a small wooden observatory on Cliff Street .
column3: Toujours en 1890, à Ottawa, il construit un petit observatoire astronomique en bois sur la rue Cliff.

column1: King was nominated seven times as Commissioner of the International Boundary Commission between 1892 and 1908, and he thus helped establish the Canadian-American border.
column2: King was nominated seven times as Commissioner of the International Boundary Commission between 1892 and 1908 , and he thus helped establish the Canadian-American border .
column3: Entre 1892 et 1908, King est nommé à sept reprises commissaire à la frontière internationale où il aide à fixer la frontière canado-américaine.

column1: The world longitude network across the Pacific Ocean was also completed under his direction.
column2: The world longitude network across the Pacific Ocean was also completed under his direction .
column3: Le réseau mondial de longitudes de l'océan Pacifique est également complété sous sa direction.

column2: In 1908 , he was named Companion of the Order of St. Michael and St. George for his work .
column3: Il sera d'ailleurs fait Compagnon de l'Ordre de Saint-Michel et Saint-Georges pour ses travaux en 1908.

column2: In 1900 , he became founding president of the Ottawa Centre for the Royal Astronomical Society of Canada , a position he maintained until his death in 1916 .
column3: En 1900, il devient président fondateur du Centre d'Ottawa de la Société Royale d'Astronomie du Canada, position qu'il conserve jusqu'à sa mort en 1916.

column1: His efforts to create a large and permanent astronomical observatory bore fruit in 1905 with the inauguration of the Dominion Observatory in Ottawa.
column2: His efforts to create a large and permanent astronomical observatory bore fruit in 1905 with the inauguration of the Dominion Observatory in Ottawa .
column3: Ses efforts pour créer un véritable observatoire astronomique aboutissent en 1905 avec l'inauguration de l'Observatoire Fédéral à Ottawa.

column1: The observatory was equipped with 38-centimetre astronomical telescope and King became its first director.
column2: The observatory was equipped with 38-centimetre astronomical telescope and King became its first director .
column3: L'observatoire est équipé d'une lunette astronomique de 38 centimètres et King en devient le premier directeur.

column1: In 1909, he succeeded where many before him had tried and failed: he founded the Geodetic Survey Division of Canada and became its first director.
column2: In 1909 , he succeeded where many before him had tried and failed : he founded the Geodetic Survey Division of Canada and became its first director .
column3: En 1909, il réussit là où plusieurs avaient échoué et fonde la Division des Levés géodésiques du Canada, dont il sera le premier directeur.

column1: Using a variety of methods, including astronomical measurements, the Division managed to precisely determine the position and elevation of many reference points throughout the country, which greatly assisted in the making of geographic maps.
column2: Using a variety of methods , including astronomical measurements , the Division managed to precisely determine the position and elevation of many reference points throughout the country , which greatly assisted in the making of geographic maps .
column3: Grâce aux travaux de la Division, qui utilise entre autres des méthodes de mesures astronomiques, la position et l'altitude de plusieurs points de repère sont déterminées avec précision sur le territoire canadien, ce qui facilite la création des cartes géographiques.

column1: In 1910, only five years after the creation of the Dominion Observatory in Ottawa, King was in charge of the Dominion Astrophysical Observatory near Victoria, British Columbia, but died before its inauguration.
column2: In 1910 , only five years after the creation of the Dominion Observatory in Ottawa , King was in charge of the Dominion Astrophysical Observatory near Victoria , British Columbia , but died before its inauguration .
column3: En 1910, soit à peine cinq ans après la création de l'Observatoire Fédéral à Ottawa, il dirige le projet de construction de l'Observatoire Fédéral d'Astrophysique à Victoria, en Colombie-Britannique, mais meurt avant son inauguration.

column1: In 1911, King was elected President of the Royal Society of Canada, the highest scientific distinction in Canada at the time.
column2: In 1911 , King was elected President of the Royal Society of Canada , the highest scientific distinction in Canada at the time .
column3: En 1911, King est élu président de la Société Royale du Canada, la plus haute distinction scientifique du Canada à l'époque.

column1: He passed away in Ottawa in 1916 at 62 years old.
column2: He passed away in Ottawa in 1916 at 62 years old .
column3: Il meurt à Ottawa en 1916, à l'âge de 62 ans.

column2: He began working at the Edison Company -LRB- which later become General Electric -RRB- in 1886 where he gained experience in mechanics and electricity .

column2: Plaskett received four honorary doctoral degrees from Canadian and American universities during his career .

column2: After obtaining his bachelor 's degree , Plaskett taught as a lecturer in the physics department at the University of Toronto .
column3: Après l'obtention de son baccalauréat, Plaskett enseigne comme chargé de cours au département de physique de l'Université de Toronto.

column2: Plaskett became an invaluable addition to the team thanks to his experience in electricity , mechanics and photography .

column2: Plaskett made his first real foray into astronomy in 1905 at the age of 39 .

column2: William Frederick King assigned him the responsibility of astrophysical work at the Dominion Observatory .

column1: During his first research project, he was responsible for studying a total eclipse of the Sun that would be visible from Labrador.
column2: During his first research project , he was responsible for studying a total eclipse of the Sun that would be visible from Labrador .
column3: Lors de son premier projet de recherche, il est responsable des observations d'une éclipse totale du Soleil qui est visible au Labrador.

column1: In 1907, after working for two years on a new spectroscope of his own design, Plaskett attached it to the telescope of the Dominion Observatory.
column2: In 1907 , after working for two years on a new spectroscope of his own design , Plaskett attached it to the telescope of the Dominion Observatory .
column3: Malgré un ciel nuageux qui empêche d'observer l'éclipse, Plaskett impressionne par le soin qu'il apporte à préparer ses observations et à rédiger son rapport scientifique.

column1: He mainly used it to measure the radial velocities of stars (the speed at which the star is moving away or toward the observer), and managed to collect several thousand spectrograms over the following years.
column2: He mainly used it to measure the radial velocities of stars -LRB- the speed at which the star is moving away or toward the observer -RRB- , and managed to collect several thousand spectrograms over the following years .
column3: En 1907, après deux ans de travail, il dote la lunette astronomique de l'Observatoire Fédéral d'un nouveau spectroscope de sa conception et entreprend principalement de mesurer la vitesse radiale des étoiles (c'est-à-dire la vitesse à laquelle les étoiles s'approchent ou s'éloignent de nous).

column1: It quickly became evident, however, that the observatory’s 38-centimetre telescope was not efficient enough for the purpose.
column2: It quickly became evident , however , that the observatory 's 38-centimetre telescope was not efficient enough for the purpose .
column3: Au cours des années qui suivent, plusieurs milliers de spectrogrammes sont collectés, mais il devient rapidement évident que la lunette astronomique de 38 centimètres n'est pas suffisamment efficace.

column2: In 1910 , Plaskett proposed to William Frederick King that a new giant telescope be constructed .

column1: In 1913, Parliament freed up funds and Plaskett worked for the next five years on the design of a 1.83-metre telescope – the biggest in the world – for the new Dominion Astrophysical Observatory to be built in Victoria, British Columbia.
column2: In 1913 , Parliament freed up funds and Plaskett worked for the next five years on the design of a 1.83-metre telescope -- the biggest in the world -- for the new Dominion Astrophysical Observatory to be built in Victoria , British Columbia .

column2: In 1922 , he discovered a binary star and the larger of the two still holds the record as the most massive known binary star ; it is known today as `` Plaskett 's Star '' .
column3: Plaskett continue son travail sur les vitesses radiales des étoiles et découvre, en 1922, une étoile binaire dont l'étoile principale est la plus massive connue jusqu'alors ; cette étoile est encore connue aujourd'hui sous le nom « d'étoile de Plaskett ».

column1: Between 1928 and 1935, Plaskett published a series of articles with Joseph Algernon Pearce on the radial velocities of stars and confirmed that our galaxy, the Milky Way, rotates.

column1: In fact, he was the first to measure the size, mass and rotational speed of the Milky Way.
column2: In fact , he was the first to measure the size , mass and rotational speed of the Milky Way .
